title: JD Vance says US hopes Pakistan cooperates with India against terrorists
content: "Our hope here is that India responds to this terrorist attack in a way that doesn't lead to a broader regional conflict," Vance said in a podcast interview with Fox News.

title: 2nd in 2+ months: Student from Nepal dies by suicide at Odisha’s KIIT
content: Another Nepalese student was discovered dead in her hostel room at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. This incident occurred nearly two and a half months after a similar death. Police suspect suicide and have ruled out foul play. The 18-year-old was a first-year BTech student. Her phone and laptop are under forensic examination. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: Tariff talks back on table? China says 'evaluating' US offer, 'door open'
content: China says it is open to restarting trade talks with the United States, but made it clear that dialogue can only move forward if Washington cancels its steep unilateral tariffs. In a statement from the commerce ministry, Beijing  insisted that words alone were not enough. China also noted multiple informal outreach attempts from the US, but said any genuine negotiations must be backed by action, not pressure or double-speak.

title: Upset Pichai calls US govt proposal to break Google: 'So far-reaching, so …'
content: Sundar Pichai voiced strong objections to the DOJ's proposed remedies in Google's antitrust case, cautioning they could cripple Google Search and jeopardize user privacy. He argued that demands to share search data and potentially sell Chrome would undermine innovation and devalue Google's investments. Pichai also highlighted privacy risks associated with the data-sharing proposal.

title: Second attack in two days: Israel hits target near Syrian presidential palace
content: Israeli airstrikes targeted areas near Syria's presidential palace following escalating clashes between pro-government forces and the Druze minority. This action, Israel's second this week, serves as a stern warning to Syria's Islamist-led leadership. The strikes followed Druze leader Sheikh Hikmat Al-Hijri's condemnation of the government's actions against his community.

title: After lynching, Mangaluru tense with another killing: Murder accused hacked to death
content: Following a mob-lynching incident, Mangaluru has imposed prohibitory orders after Suhas Shetty, an accused in the 2022 Mohammed Fazil murder, was fatally attacked in Bajpe. The restrictions, under Section 163 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, will be in effect from May 2 to May 6, prohibiting gatherings and other activities.

title: Kohl fires CEO Ashley Buchanan for romantic relationship with vendor
content: Kohl's fired CEO Ashley Buchanan after discovering a conflict of interest involving a business deal with Chandra Holt, his former romantic partner and ex-Walmart colleague. Buchanan directed Kohl's to engage in vendor transactions with Holt's company, leading to his termination and forfeiture of equity awards. Michael Bender has been named interim CEO.

title: Air India may face $600m loss from Pak airspace ban, mulls China route: Report
content: Air India anticipates incurring approximately $600 million in extra expenses if Pakistan's airspace ban persists for a year, prompting a request for government compensation. The airline projects losses exceeding $591 million annually due to increased fuel consumption and extended flight durations.

title: Mumbai Indians achieve historic feat after 13-years against Rajasthan
content: Hardik Pandya led Mumbai Indians to a dominant 100-run victory against Rajasthan Royals in Jaipur, a feat last achieved by an MI captain in 2012. MI's strong batting performance, highlighted by Pandya's unbeaten 48, propelled them to 217/2. Trent Boult and Karn Sharma's three-wicket hauls then dismantled RR for just 117.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,400; BSE Sensex rises over 450 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Friday, the first trading day of the month. While Nifty50 rose over 100 points to cross 24,400, BSE Sensex was above 80,600.

title: Sam Altman shares Ghibli photo with Satya Nadella, Microsoft CEO responds
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared a Ghibli-style photo with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, sparking interest amid reports of growing tension between the two leaders. This comes after a Wall Street Journal article highlighted a potential shift in their once-close partnership, fueled by Microsoft's independent AI ventures and disagreements over AGI timelines.

title: 'US stands strong with India, PM Modi has our full support': US on Pahalgam attack
content: Amid escalating tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, the United States has affirmed its unwavering support for India against terrorism. The US State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce conveyed President Trump's full support to Prime Minister Modi, emphasizing ongoing communication with both Indian and Pakistani authorities.

title: Pak PM, president pledge 'befitting response' to any act of aggression
content: Amid rising tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistani leaders Shehbaz Sharif and Asif Ali Zardari have vowed a strong response to any Indian aggression. India, meanwhile, has promised to hunt down the perpetrators, with PM Modi granting the armed forces full operational freedom.

title: Navy intensifies muscle-flexing against Pak as small arms fire continues across LoC
content: Amid heightened tensions, the Indian Navy has intensified its presence in the Arabian Sea, issuing warnings to ships near its firing drill zone, close to where the Pakistan Navy is also conducting exercises.

title: 'Most US iPhones to be sourced in India': Apple CEO amid trade war with China
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook announced that most US iPhones would be sourced from India due to rising US-China tariff tensions. The tariffs on Chinese imports could cost Apple up to $900 million. Despite these pressures, Apple reported strong earnings for the first three months of the year, with a profit increase of 4.8% and a revenue rise of 5.1%.

title: ‘Jaat’ box office: Sunny Deol starrer sees sharp drop amid new releases
content: Released on April 10, 2025, Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' underperformed compared to 'Gadar 2,' struggling to maintain momentum despite a decent opening. The film's box office earnings have declined, particularly during weekdays, with a total collection of ₹87.04 crores after 22 days. Facing stiff competition from new releases like 'Raid 2' and South Indian films, 'Jaat' is finding it difficult to reach the ₹100 crore mark.

title: Best Magnesium supplement and the right time to take it
content: Magnesium, a crucial mineral for over 300 bodily functions, is naturally found in various foods, but supplements become necessary when dietary intake is insufficient or due to certain medical conditions. Dr. Saurabh Sethi recommends magnesium glycinate for sleep, L-threonate for mental clarity, and citrate for constipation. He advises against magnesium oxide due to poor absorption.

title: Ajay Devgn breaks silence on reports of him owning a private jet
content: Ajay Devgn, amidst promoting 'Raid 2', addressed long-standing rumors about owning a private jet. While reports suggested he bought a six-seater Hawker 800 in 2010, Devgn clarified that the purchase didn't materialize, despite initial plans. The actor, known for action films like 'Singham', is married to Kajol. Together, they own properties including a Juhu bungalow and a London property.

title: Trump threatens to impose sanctions against nations buying oil from Iran
content: Donald Trump threatened sanctions on Iranian oil buyers, halting US business ties, after nuclear talks were delayed. Oman cited logistical reasons for postponing the meeting, while Iran affirmed commitment to a fair agreement. Tensions rise amid stalled negotiations, with the US hinting at military action and Iran considering nuclear weapons development.

title: HC warns Ramdev of contempt, says take down video targeting Rooh Afza
content: The Delhi high court has found Yoga guru Ramdev in contempt for defying an earlier undertaking regarding disparaging remarks against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. The court expressed concern over Ramdev's lack of control and ordered him to remove an offensive social media video within 24 hours.

title: Pak FM stations ban Indian songs amid rising tensions after J&K terror attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror incident that resulted in 26 deaths, Pakistani FM radio stations have ceased broadcasting Indian songs. The Pakistan Broadcasters Association's decision, supported by the information minister, reflects heightened tensions between the two nations. This action aligns with retaliatory measures taken by India, including restrictions on airspace and diplomatic relations.

title: Trump makes Rubio interim NSA, nominates Mike Waltz for UN ambassador
content: President Trump announced Marco Rubio as the interim National Security Advisor, succeeding Mike Waltz, while also nominating Waltz as the United Nations Ambassador. Waltz's departure follows criticism and reports of staff dismissals within the National Security Council. Trump expressed confidence in both Rubio and Waltz to prioritize national interests and enhance global safety in their respective roles.

title: ‘Raid 2’ box office day 1: Ajay Devgn’s crime thriller sequel earns Rs 18.25 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' made a solid start at the box office, earning approximately Rs. 18.25 crore on its opening day, despite facing stiff competition from Suriya’s ‘Retro’ and Nani’s ‘HIT: The Third Case’. While ‘Retro’ slightly surpassed ‘Raid 2’ in initial earnings, all three films are vying for the top spot, promising an intense weekend showdown.

title: Lend, baby, lend: Borrowers getting younger
content: Indians are accessing credit much earlier, with the average age for first-time borrowers dropping significantly across generations. This shift is driven by increased disposable income, pre-approved loans from banks, and the availability of unsecured credit products like credit cards and personal loans. The Jan Dhan-Aadhaar-Mobile trinity has also streamlined borrower tracking, contributing to this trend.

title: Dravid can't hide disappointment as Suryavanshi falls for a duck
content: After a record-breaking century in the previous game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Rajasthan Royals' young star, had a disappointing outing, dismissed for a duck against Mumbai Indians. Mumbai Indians capitalized on favorable batting conditions, with Rohit Sharma and Ryan Rickelton setting up a strong foundation. Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya's explosive innings propelled MI to a formidable total of 217.

title: Who is Jordon Hudson? Inside the life of Bill Belichick’s younger girlfriend
content: Jordon Hudson, hailing from a Maine fishing family and a cheerleading background, met Bill Belichick on a flight in 2021. Their relationship, confirmed in June 2024, has drawn public attention due to their age gap and Hudson's advocacy for Maine's fishing communities. Despite facing criticism, Hudson emphasizes her heritage, hard work, and personal convictions.

title: Government call on caste count game changer, exposes Congress: BJP
content: BJP lauded the Centre's decision to include caste enumeration in the upcoming census, emphasizing the NDA's dedication to social justice. Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticized Congress for its alleged hypocrisy on OBC welfare, citing historical opposition to reservations by the Nehru-Gandhi family. He contrasted this with PM Modi's commitment to social justice through effective policies.

title: Taylor Swift breaks silence as Travis Kelce partied with Jason Kelce and Timberlake
content: Taylor Swift recently engaged with fans online by liking a video of triplets enjoying her music. This happened while Travis Kelce was in Las Vegas with Justin Timberlake and Jason Kelce. Sources say Swift and Kelce are enjoying their time together despite busy schedules. Kelce is back from his Las Vegas trip. Fans are eager for the upcoming NFL season.

title: Congress dismisses caste census announcement as ‘diversionary tactic’ of government
content: Congress criticized PM Modi for previously dismissing Rahul Gandhi's caste census demand as "urban naxal mindset," while now BJP leaders are claiming credit for the government's decision to enumerate caste in the delayed census. The CWC will convene to discuss the government's decision and potentially increase pressure on related demands, highlighting BJP's shift under Rahul's influence.

title: US clears $131 million sale of defence software, equipment to India
content: The Trump administration has approved a $131 million sale of maritime domain awareness software and equipment to India. This sale aims to bolster India's maritime capabilities and strategic posture in the Indo-Pacific region. The US believes this will strengthen the US-Indian strategic relationship and promote stability and security in the region.

title: 'He's safe, likely to return soon': Pregnant wife of BSF jawan in Pak custody
content: Rajani Shaw, wife of detained BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw, sought answers in Pathankot regarding her husband's situation in Pakistan. BSF officers in Firozpur assured her that Purnam was safe and his release was likely soon, with talks underway with Pakistan Rangers.

title: Acquitted by Guj judge in 1994, man sent to jail by SC for raping 10-yr-old
content: In a landmark decision, the Supreme Court overturned a trial court's acquittal of a man for sexually assaulting a 10-year-old girl 32 years ago. The apex court upheld a Gujarat High Court ruling, sentencing the now 54-year-old convict to 10 years in prison. The SC criticized the initial acquittal, highlighting the overwhelming evidence against the accused.

title: Brunson's clutch 3 sinks Pistons; Knicks advance
content: Jalen Brunson made a 3-pointer with 5.1 seconds remaining and the Knicks defeated the Pistons 116-113 to advance to the Eastern semifinals.

title: Redick: Lakers must get in 'championship shape'
content: Head coach JJ Redick says the Lakers must get into "championship shape" if they're going to contend for an NBA title next season.

title: Leafs finish off Senators for spot in East semifinals
content: Max Pacioretty scored a late tiebreaking goal in the third period to send the Toronto Maple Leafs to a series-clinching 4-2 win over the Ottawa Senators on Thursday night in Game 6 of the first-round matchup.

title: Sources: Rangers close to hiring Sullivan as coach
content: The New York Rangers are in advanced contract talks to make former Pittsburgh Penguins coach Mike Sullivan the next head coach, sources told ESPN's Emily Kaplan and Kevin Weekes on Thursday.

title: Haliburton's dad to stay away from Pacers games
content: After conversations with the Pacers' front office, Tyrese Haliburton's father, John, will not attend the team's home and road games for the foreseeable future, a Pacers spokesperson told ESPN.

title: 'Frustrating end': Tigers DFA struggling Maeda
content: Kenta Maeda, who has a 6.21 ERA in his 36 appearances for the Tigers spanning two seasons, was designated for assignment. Detroit recalled prospect Tyler Owens.

title: Fan who fell at PNC Park still in critical condition
content: The man who fell from the 21-foot-high Clemente Wall onto the field at PNC Park on Wednesday remained in critical condition. Police called the incident "accidental."

title: '27 QB prospect Taylor commits to Cornhuskers
content: Quarterback Trae Taylor, one of the top pocket passers in the 2027 recruiting class, announced his commitment to Nebraska over Illinois, LSU and Texas A&M.

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: Who sits atop our list?
content: The NL is still dominating MLB -- and our rankings -- while an AL East team continues to tumble down the Week 5 list.

title: What a championship for these 10 playoff teams would say about the NBA
content: From the Celtics to the Thunder, here's how potential titles could lead into varied versions of an NBA future.

title: NBA offseason preview: Complete guides for Pistons, Lakers and every eliminated team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Which NFL teams already need a QB for 2026? Reid’s first-round mock draft has four in the top 10
content: Four QBs in the top 10? Two big trades? Let's make way-too-early predictions for every pick of next year's first round.

title: Europa League continues to offer Man United a lifeline for this season
content: This Manchester United team that has struggled in the Premier League continues to look far better in the Europa League.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal closed and the draft ended. Who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Times Square fights: How boxing is failing its rank and file boxers
content: On a weekend where Ryan Garcia and Canelo Alvarez are stealing the spotlight, the sport is failing its true boxers.

title: Betting the 151st Kentucky Derby: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: The basics and insider intel you need to sound smart while betting the most exciting two minutes in sports.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Wins put Man Utd, Spurs on brink of unlikely final
content: Big wins for Man United and Tottenham in the Europa League semifinals kept alive their hopes of lifting a major trophy and qualifying for the Champions League.

title: Sources: Brazil give Ancelotti May 26 deadline
content: The Brazilian Football Confederation (CBF) on Thursday extended its deadline for Carlo Ancelotti to take over as national team coach, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: De Bruyne in talks for MLS move to Fire
content: Chicago Fire FC is in talks with Manchester City star Kevin De Bruyne on a designated player contract, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Maguire revels in 'Harrydinho' nickname: 'Brilliant'
content: Harry Maguire has welcomed his new Brazilian-inspired nickname after the centre-back's unexpected trickery helped put Manchester United on course for a stunning 3-0 win at Athletic Club.

title: Amorim: Man Utd can't take final place for granted
content: Ruben Amorim warned his Manchester United players that they have not yet booked their place in the Europa League final despite a dominant 3-0 win over Athletic Club in their semifinal first leg.

title: Chelsea with one foot in final after 1st-leg rout
content: Goals from Jadon Sancho and Noni Madueke and a brace from Nicolas Jackson gave Chelsea a comfortable 4-1 win over Swedish side Djurgården on a tricky artificial pitch in the first leg of their Conference League semifinal on Thursday.

title: Spain national team superfan Manolo dies at 76
content: Globally recognized Spanish superfan Manuel Caceres, known for his drum-pounding support of Spain's national team across ten World Cups and eight Euros, died on Thursday at the age of 76.

title: Sources: Barça's Kounde to miss Inter 2nd leg
content: Barcelona have confirmed defender Jules Kounde suffered a hamstring injury in Wednesday's 3-3 Champions League semifinal draw against Inter Milan, with sources telling ESPN he will miss the second leg in Italy next week.

title: Advantage PSG vs. Arsenal, Barca-Inter thriller: UCL semifinals, assessed
content: The Champions League, Europa League and Europa Conference League are thrilling as we hit the semifinals. Can Arsenal fight back vs. PSG? Let's break down all the first legs and project what's to come.

title: Real Madrid's running battle with referees: How did it start? When will it end?
content: Madrid's anger escalated in the Copa del Rey final, with an official in tears and three players sent off.

title: Draft tiers at forward/center
content: Andre Snellings goes through the different tiers at the forward/center position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: If parity is NWSL's 'superpower' vs. Europe competition, is expansion its kryptonite?
content: The NWSL has excitement that the UEFA Women's Champions League and England's WSL can't match -- but how long will it last?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal join race to sign Huijsen
content: Arsenal are reportedly looking to sign Bournemouth defender Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Critical care castaways of tri-State border
content: Many lives remain at risk in the Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh, where the government district hospital refers over 75% of critical care and emergency cases to hospitals located more than 100 kilometres away. Despite being the vital junction where Andhra Pradesh meets Tamil Nadu and Karnataka, critical healthcare continues to elude the predominantly rural district, finds K. Umashanker

title: PM Modi in Kerala LIVE: PM Modi set to open Vizhinjam Port; putting Kerala on global maritime map
content: The first semi-automated port in the country, Vizhinjam seaport positions itself as one of the most technologically sophisticated transshipment ports globally

title: PM Modi in Thiruvananthapuram, set to commission Vizhinjam international seaport
content: Thiruvananthapuram has come under heightened security and traffic control on account of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s arrival

title: Blackspots resurface showing all is not well in solid waste management in Mangaluru
content: Blackspots have gone up in the past one year, but the civic Commissioner maintained that the corporation has not been receiving complaints from people regarding garbage not being lifted

title: VHP calls for bandh in Dakshina Kannada, Police impose prohibitory orders in Mangaluru
content: People came in large numbers and visited the mortuary of the private hospital in Mangaluru where the body of Bajrang Dal activist Suhas Shetty was kept on May 1.

title: Passenger, airport ground staffers held with smuggled gold worth ₹3.45 crore at RGIA
content: Acting on specific intelligence inputs, officers from the Hyderabad zonal unit of the DRI intercepted the accused

title: Experts say listing of castes will be first challenge in Census
content: In the absence of a concrete listing of castes and communities to be enumerated, the 2011 Census showed over 46 lakh different ‘castes’, with many citizens entering their surnames under the field for caste

title: Centre defers May 4 meeting with farmers over participation of Punjab Government
content: Union Agriculture Ministry claims the farming community harboured deep resentment against the Punjab government over the eviction of protesting farmers from Shambhu and Khanauri border points in March

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Pakistani troops violate ceasefire for 8th night, residents near LoC begin readying bunkers
content: America stands ‘in solidarity’ with India and supports its ‘right to defend itself’, says U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth; Defence Minister Rajnath Singh points out that Pakistan has a ‘history’ of supporting and training terrorist organisations

title: HC pulls up M.P. Police, over ‘inaction’ on Ambedkar statue vandalism
content: The petition was filed by Jitendra Ahirwar, a local social activist, who alleged ‘inaction’ on the local police’s part and sought the court’s intervention

title: A.P. CM assures support to a widow in Nellorepalem
content: Chandrababu Naidu directed Nellore District Collector O. Anand to offer DSC coaching to Susmita, and to provide a drone to her younger brother, who has completed ITI, for agricultural purposes

title: Opposition slams Maharashtra government over claims of good performance
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and member of the Maharashtra Legislative Council, Ambadas Danve’s statement was in the response to the CM’s 100-day performance report that he released on Maharashtra Day, May 1, 2025.

title: 4 Killed, Over 120 Flights Delayed After Heavy Rain, Dust Storm In Delhi-NCR
content: Strong winds and a dust storm were followed by heavy rains in Delhi and the National Capital Region, bringing a drop in temperatures.

title: China Says 'Evaluating' US Tariff Talks Talks, But Wants Trump's "Sincerity"
content: Punishing US tariffs that have reached 145 percent on many Chinese products came into force in April while Beijing has responded with fresh 125 percent duties on imports from the United States.

title: Elon Musk-Owned Neuralink's Speech Restoration Device Gets FDA's 'Breakthrough' Tag
content: The device would help those affected by amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), stroke, spinal cord injury, cerebral palsy, multiple sclerosis, and other neurological conditions.

title: "Pak, To Extent They're Responsible...": JD Vance On Tracking Pahalgam Attack Terrorists
content: Last month, JD Vance called Prime Minister Narendra Modi and strongly condemned the Pahalgam terror attack and conveyed his deepest condolences on the loss of lives.

title: Pak Army Continues Ceasefire Violation Along LoC For 8th Consecutive Night
content: Pakistan Army violated ceasefire along the Line of Control for the eight consecutive night on Thursday by initiating unprovoked firing.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: Pakistan Violates Ceasefire For 8th Consecutive Night
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control (LoC) for the eighth consecutive night on Wednesday.

title: Apple Expects $900 Million Tariff Hit As It Shifts US iPhone Supply To India
content: Apple expects US tariffs to cost $900 million in the current quarter, even though their impact was "limited" at the start of this year, chief executive Tim Cook said.

title: PM Modi To Commission Vizhinjam International Seaport In Kerala Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will officially commission the Vizhinjam International Seaport today, placing Kerala firmly on the global maritime map.

title: "Ties With Pakistan Will Never Improve Until...": Farooq Abdullah On J&K Attack
content: Terming Pakistan as a "failed state", National Conference (NC) president Farooq Abdullah Thursday said relations between New Delhi and Islamabad would never improve until a peoples' government is elected in the neighbouring country.

title: Europe Preparing New Sanctions On Russia: French Minister
content: French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said Thursday that the European Union is preparing to hit Russia with a 17th round of sanctions, describing President Vladimir Putin as the "sole obstacle" to peace in Ukraine.

title: Bangladesh Court Issues Show-Cause Notice To Sheikh Hasina In Contempt Case
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has issued a show-cause notice to deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina and her aide in a contempt of court case.

title: Water Pipe Bursts In Guwahati, Causes Waterlogging, Traffic Disruption
content: A sudden burst of a water pipe in Guwahati's Chandmari area on Thursday evening caused severe waterlogging and disrupted traffic in the area.

title: Railway Protection Force, BSF Strengthen Security Near Bangladesh Border
content: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) has begun conducting joint patrolling in sensitive areas along the India-Bangladesh border.

title: Mike Waltz Named UN Envoy, Rubio Becomes Interim National Security Adviser
content: U.S. President Donald Trump ousted his national security adviser Mike Waltz on Thursday and named Secretary of State Marco Rubio as his interim replacement in the first major shakeup of Trump's inner circle since he took office in January.

title: 24-Year-Old Woman Found Dead At Friend's House in UP's Lucknow
content: Police are searching for a man after the body of a 24-year-old woman was found in his rented house in the Mahanagar area here, an official said on Thursday.

title: "Economic Terrorism": Iran Slams Fresh US Sanctions
content: Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei has strongly condemned fresh US sanctions on individuals and entities in Iran and other countries on the pretext of cooperating with Tehran in different areas.

title: Rajasthan Man Arrested For Spying For Pakistan's ISI
content: Rajasthan Intelligence has arrested a Jaisalmer resident, Pathan Khan, for allegedly spying for Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), an official release said.

title: "We Stand With India": US Defence Secretary On Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth spoke to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and extended condolences over the loss of lives in the terror attack in Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Above-normal maximum, minimum temperatures in Andhra Pradesh in May: IMD
content: The probability of above-normal minimum temperatures in the State is between 33.5% and 65%; however, the number of heatwave days, on an average, is likely to be fewer in May

title: Jostling intensifies among parties in Bihar to claim credit over caste Census
content: Ruling JD(U) claims it was because of CM Nitish Kumar, whereas Congress gave credit to Rahul Gandhi; RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says it was important to see when the caste Census gets conducted as it is delayed by four years

title: Lingayats and Vokkaligas want implementation of ‘caste census’ put on hold till enumeration by Union govt.
content: Union government’s caste census announcement complicates Karnataka’s survey implementation, sparking debate among influential communities and political figures.

title: Case filed over alleged pro-Pakistan sloganeering at Indore protest against Pahalgam attack
content: An anti-Pakistan protest had been organised on April 25 at Badwali in Sadar Bazaar by the local Muslim community

title: Communal tension in Nainital after minor assaulted by senior citizen
content: As the news of the incident spread, people gathered near the market where the accused used to work, and vandalised shops run by the minority community; police have placed restrictions dampening tourist footfall during peak summer season

title: NDA government bringing light in the lives of workers: A.P. CM
content: New 100-bed hospitals are being built in Guntur and Sri City each, and a 30-bed hospital in Kurnool for the healthcare of workers, says Naidu

title: If you ask ‘Crazy’ Mohan to write dialogues for one film, he will write for four: K.S. Ravikumar
content: 25 books compiling the works, including plays and short stories, of actor and playwright ‘Crazy’ Mohan released

title: Udhayanidhi launches work on Phase 3 of Chennai Peripheral Ring Road Project
content: The third phase spans 30.10 km from the Tiruvallur Bypass to Sriperumbudur, comprising four bridges and one railway over bridge

title: Indians and Pakistanis at Attari border: The people who bear the weight of a divided history
content: Amid a relatively quiet Beating Retreat ceremony that takes place every evening at the Attari-Wagah border are Indians and Pakistanis, who share similar emotions. Some cry and others pray for resilience as nationals from both countries cross borders, leaving family members grieving and in disquiet. Vikas Vasudeva reports from the border villages and Amritsar, just 50 km down the road from Lahore, once its twin city

title: Veteran Congress leader Girija Vyas passes away
content: The former Union Minister had sustained burn injuries during a Gangaur puja ritual at her residence in Udaipur

title: Mallika Sarabhai defies pressure, joins ASHA workers’ protest virtually
content: Ms. Sarabhai participated in the event, ‘Honorarium for ASHA workers’, a citizen’s crowd funding campaign, by transferring honorarium of ₹1,000 to one of the protesting workers

title: 31-Year-Old Taxi Driver Arrested For Allegedly Killing His Live-In Partner
content: A 31-year-old taxi driver has been arrested for allegedly killing his live-in partner six months ago in Uttarakhand, Gurugram police said on Thursday.

title: Trump Threatens Countries Purchasing Iranian Oil With Sanctions
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said all purchases of Iranian oil or petrochemicals products must stop and that any country or person buying any from the country would be immediately subject to secondary sanctions.

title: Vizhinjam seaport set to boost South Asia’s maritime trade
content: PM Narendra Modi to dedicate the project to the nation; the seaport will have an AI-driven control room; the new port is expected to reduce India’s dependence on international facilities

title: See AI as a creative enabler, not a job displacer, say industry leaders at WAVES 2025
content: Sessions highlight India’s growing role in content creation and AI-driven storytelling, with emphasis on creativity, skill, and innovation

title: At Congress Working Committee meet, Congress seeks amendment to lift 50% cap on reservation
content: The Congress says caste census is diversionary tactics; CWC is also likely to reiterate its demand for strong action in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Army, Air Force see major changes at the top as new leaders take over
content: Lt. Gen. Pratik Sharma is the new Northern Army Commander; changes at the top will initiate a series of changes in the top hierarchy in the Army and IAF

title: HAL clears Army and Air Force versions of Dhruv helicopter
content: The armed forces had temporarily grounded all their ALHs following a crash during a training sortie in January but the Pahalgam terror attack led to the security personnel requiring the services of the helicopter

title: Sonu Nigam sparks row over Kannada song request, invokes Pahalgam attack
content: Singer Sonu Nigam has invited backlash for getting upset with a boy who requested for a Kannada song during his concert in a college in Bengaluru

title: Centre brings raw sugar into regulatory ambit
content: Union government expands Sugar (Control) Order to include raw sugar and khandsari units, aims for better regulation and transparency

title: Opposition attacks Maharashtra CM’s report, cites rural distress and farmer suicides
content: In the 100-day performance report, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that 12 of the 48 departments have performed well and achieved 100% of their targets

title: Census may be held in 2026 to match delimitation schedule, says Union Minister Kishan Reddy
content: According to the 84th Constitutional Amendment Act of 2001, the redrawing of boundaries of the constituencies is to be carried out on the basis of population data of the first Census after 2026. The current seats are drawn on the basis of 1971 Census.

title: Bumper harvest, wheat procurement to cross target: Food Ministry
content: Wheat procurement for the 2025-26 season is progressing without hitches in key States, with the Union Food Ministry reporting 256.31 LMT already secured against this season’s target of 312 LMT

title: U.S. notifies potential sale of maritime surveillance tech worth $131 million to India
content: The Indo-Pacific maritime Domain Awareness, announced by the Quad grouping in 2022, will help India bolster its maritime security

title: Pahalgam terror attack: J&K Waqf Board provides job to slain pony operator’s brother
content: Syed Nazakat Ahmad, brother of the victim, said he feels proud that his brother laid down his life to save others

title: Four die, seven injured in massive fire at hotel in Ajmer
content: A woman saved the life of her three-year-old son by tossing him from a window to a man standing in the lane

title: Veerashaiva-Lingayats to seek separate religion code in upcoming census
content: The idea of separate religion status for Lingayats had been a widely debated issue ahead of the 2018 Assembly elections in Karnataka

title: U.S. based Kashmiri activist Syed Ghulam Nabi Fai declared ‘proclaimed offender’
content: Court order is based on an FIR filed by Budgam police in 2020 under sections of UAPA; Fai has 30 days to surrender

title: Man, neighbour killed, three others injured in fire triggered by gas cylinder leak in Bengaluru, son booked for negligence
content: The Madanayakanahalli police have registered an FIR against an 18-year-old student, son of one of the victims, for allegedly triggering the LPG cylinder leak

title: NHRC asks 11 States to protect vulnerable people from heat waves
content: Commission highlights NCRB data showing 3,798 deaths due to heat, sun strokes between 2018 and 2022; calls for changes in working hours, treatment protocols, and shelters equipped with relief materials

title: Maharashtra celebrates Foundation Day with vibrant tributes to heritage, progress
content: On 65th Maharashtra Day, leaders pay homage to martyrs and announce new policy initiatives for State growth

title: 'Occupy North East if India attacks Pakistan': Yunus government aide
content: Prabin Kalita is a journalist at the Times of India and is currently the Chief of Bureau (northeast). he has been reporting in mainstream Indian national media since 2001 . he is covering insurgency—internal and cross-border, politics, natural calamities, environment etc.

title: Liberal education in a rapidly changing world: academics to share their thoughts at The Huddle
content: At The Hindu Huddle on May 9 and 10, educators from some of India’s top institutions to explore how a liberal education creates a well-rounded world view and imparts the skills to navigate an uncertain future

title: Odisha moves to fast-track inclusion of urban poor in welfare schemes through SAHAJOG
content: The initiative focuses on identifying eligible beneficiaries in urban poor communities and linking them to the appropriate schemes

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan moots ‘war room’ for monitoring drinking water supply
content: Aim is to address problems in the least possible time, he says; he also emphasises the need to link agriculture with MGNREGS

title: NIHL becomes a leading cause of acquired auditory damage
content: Experts at AIISH in Mysuru suggest making noise mapping and hearing screening mandatory across all industries exposed to hazardous noise levels, as noise-induced hearing loss (NIHL) has become a leading cause of acquired auditory damage

title: Chandrababu Naidu virtually inaugurates 11 MSME parks, lays foundation stone for 39 more
content: The Andhra Pradesh government will create at least one MSME park in each constituency. In first phase, MSME parks will be developed in 40 constituencies with an investment of ₹2,000 crore, says the Chief Minister

title: Fix a timeline, allocate funds, make caste census a priority: Kharge
content: All the Opposition parties had been demanding a caste census, and Rahul Gandhi had taken the lead on the issue, the Congress leader said

title: ‘Remove 50% cap on reservations to ensure equal opportunities’
content: Ambedkar Porata Samithi President Soru Sambayya said that the caste census must be conducted in a time bound manner so that the population of each community would be known officially to the government

title: If Centre does not start caste census in three months, it means it is disinterested, claims Kharge
content: Congress is fully behind the Centre in its anti-terror operations, according to Leader of Opposition in the Rajya Sabha

title: Naidu has shown the ‘template of usurping power’ without having numbers, alleges Jagan
content: Stating that ‘Jagan 2.0’ will be different, the YSRCP chief lauds all those who have stood for value-based politics

title: Procedural lapse suspected in Yadadri propellant unit blast, PESO launches probe
content: The condition of the five injured workers remains critical, with three on ventilator support due to severe burns, while two others are under observation in the ICU and general ward

title: NCAA deal with sportsbooks looks crass but is sneaky smart
content: college athletes face problems because of prop bets . they work with law enforcement, sports wagering integrity watchdogs and casinos themselves . the NCAA's managing director of enforcement spearheads the association's anti-gambling education efforts . "it's absolutely a challenge," says the official of enforcement .

title: Browns QB Shedeur Sanders makes surprise visit to Cleveland-area high school
content: shedeur Sanders was selected by the Browns in the fifth round . the 6-foot-2 quarterback was taken with the no. 144 pick by the browns . he surprised students at John Marshall High school with words of affirmation .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Brunson dagger sends Knicks to next round
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 3 New York Knicks defeated the No. 6 Detroit Pistons in Game 6 to advance to the second round by winning on a 3-point dagger from Jalen Brunson .

title: Follow live: Clippers in control, Game 7 looms
content: the Detroit Pistons defeated the new york Knicks 116-113 . the Clippers are now the ones playing to extend their playoff run . they beat the Boston Celtics in the Eastern Conference semifinals on friday . jalen Brunson led new york with 40 points .

title: Who are your club's future stars? Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 teams are updated below for where they stand entering May . mrs braxton bragg, rHP Levi Wells and c/1B/OF Ethan Anderson were all close to ms bragg . all 30 of these lists are updated regularly throughout the 2025 season .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Sandhagen gets past Figueiredo at UFC Fight Night
content: cory Sandhagen takes on former men's flyweight champion deiveson Figueiredo in main event at UFC Fight Night in Des Moines, Iowa . the bantamweight contender enters the fight following a unanimous decision loss to Umar Nurmagomedov last august . he was riding a three-fight win streak that included victories over Song Yadong and Marlon "Chito" Vera .

title: Bradley's take: Breaking down Garcia vs. Romero, Teofimo-Barboza and more
content: the popular tourist destination will be the stage to a boxing show featuring some of the best fighters in the sport . the ever-popular Ryan Garcia matches up against former junior welterweight champion Rolando "Rolly" Romero . Devin Haney returns against former 140-pound champion Jose Ramirez .

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .
